page.title: 20FISHING
page.content: Regent's Canal is famous for it's narrow boats,locks and fish.There are many types of fish e.g pike,roach and perch.The most common caught,however, are rudd.Very rare ones are bream and jack-pike.I use different baits such as maggots,sweetcorn and worms.The enemy of the angler is the eel and when one is caught you lose your hook in its guts.All the anglers return their fish gently.I get most fun out of catching perch as they put up the biggest fight. There are some locks and the fish wait for the barges to go through but the eels can go over the weirs.To fish you have to buy a yearly licence which cost five pounds.The Thames Water Authority own the canal and they have rules on the use of lead weights which can kill birds of the canal.Fishing is my favourite sport.
